content:
• Monday, August 20, 2012
  • FN

    More on Fabrinet (NYSE:FN): FQ4 beats on the bottom line but misses on its top line as net...

    More on Fabrinet (NYSE:FN): FQ4 beats on the bottom line but misses on its top line as net earnings plunged 55%. Per share earnings were pressured by lower revenue and higher expenses, but core profit beat expectations as the company returns to its feet following the Thailand floods by completing construction on a new manufacturing facility and winning new business. Shares +5.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM
  • MANU

    Manchester United (NYSE:MANU) +1.7% AH after George Soros discloses he holds a 3.1M share, 7.85%...

    Manchester United (NYSE:MANU) +1.7% AH after George Soros discloses he holds a 3.1M share, 7.85% stake in the marquee soccer club. Man U remains down 5% from its $14 IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) -3.5% AH after the ITC decides not to review an administrative law judge's...

    VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) -3.5% AH after the ITC decides not to review an administrative law judge's decision to end an investigation into a patent infringement complaint against Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), citing a "lack of standing." VirnetX had filed a petition asking for the decision to be overturned. (ITC ruling - PDF)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • IMUC

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC) -11.5% AH after president and CEO Manish Singh resigns....

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC) -11.5% AH after president and CEO Manish Singh resigns. The drug developer's chief scientific officer and chairman John Yu will assume the roles on an interim basis until a permanent successor is selected.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • URBN

    More on Urban Outfitters' FQ2: Same-store sales fell 1% Y/Y (even with FQ1), but...

    More on Urban Outfitters' FQ2: Same-store sales fell 1% Y/Y (even with FQ1), but direct-to-consumer sales rose 22% (better than FQ1's 15%). Free People brand retail sales +12%, Urban Outfitters +6%, Anthropologie flat - all 3 growth rates were better than FQ1. Gross margin was 37.6%, down 30 bps Y/Y but up 200 bps Q/Q. Wholesale revenue +17% Y/Y. 14 stores opened during quarter, 1 closed. URBN +16.6% AH. CC underway (webcast). (PR) (prepared comments - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • NRG

    NRG Energy (NRG +3.3%) ended higher as Barclays raised its price target on the shares to...

    NRG Energy (NRG +3.3%) ended higher as Barclays raised its price target on the shares to $24 from $22 and boosted earnings estimates for the next two years. The firm says its actions "reflect full treatment of the merger synergies, solar EBITDA guidance and the timing of the Marsh Landing plant on-line in 2013."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • NDSN

    Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN): FQ3 EPS of $1.06 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $380M (+22% Y/Y) beats by...

    Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN): FQ3 EPS of $1.06 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $380M (+22% Y/Y) beats by $22M. Shares +9.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • ASIYF

    Acer (OTC:ASIYF) fell 2.6% in Taipei after reporting Q2 revenue of NT$111B ($3.7B) and net...

    Acer (OTC:ASIYF) fell 2.6% in Taipei after reporting Q2 revenue of NT$111B ($3.7B) and net income of NT$56M ($1.9M), below consensus forecasts. The world's #4 PC maker said demand from China, thus far a bastion of strength, is now softening, and that it now expects global 2012 shipment growth of just 0-5%. Nonetheless, beaten-down rivals Dell (DELL-OLD +2.8%) and  H-P (HPQ +2.9%) rallied ahead of their earnings reports, respectively due tomorrow and Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • DWA

    Dreamworks (NASDAQ:DWA) +4.4% AH after announcing a new distribution deal with 20th Century Fox,...

    Dreamworks (NASDAQ:DWA) +4.4% AH after announcing a new distribution deal with 20th Century Fox, following earlier speculation that it might ink a deal with Sony (NYSE:SNE). DWA says the five-year agreement with Fox "presents more favorable economics... taking advantage of lower costs associated with the emerging digital distribution landscape and managing domestic television distribution in-house."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANGI

    Six days after plunging thanks to a lockup expiration, Angie's List (ANGI -7.4%) sold off to...

    Six days after plunging thanks to a lockup expiration, Angie's List (ANGI -7.4%) sold off to $9.85 today, making fresh lows in the process. After trading as high as $19.82 in March, shares are now down 24% from last November's $13 IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • TUES

    Tuesday Morning (NASDAQ:TUES): FQ4 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $196.4M (+0.8% Y/Y)...

    Tuesday Morning (NASDAQ:TUES): FQ4 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $196.4M (+0.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q2 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $676M (+11% Y/Y)...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q2 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $676M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • TTC

    Toro (TTC -4.7%) shares are downgraded by Raymond James ahead of Thursday's FQ3 report: "Recent...

    Toro (TTC -4.7%) shares are downgraded by Raymond James ahead of Thursday's FQ3 report: "Recent results from competitors/suppliers have been hurt by the late-season drought, and while we believe Toro will post better relative results, we do not believe its business will be totally unscathed... now is a good time to take profits."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +2.9%) has spiked in afternoon trading, apparently on new M&A rumors....

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +2.9%) has spiked in afternoon trading, apparently on new M&A rumors. With 40.3% of OCZ's float shorted as of July 31, it doesn't take much to cause a squeeze. (Seagate rumors: the rise, the fall)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 10 Comments
  • JKS

    Adding to JinkoSolar's (JKS +12.8%) good fortune today is the company's earlier announcement...

    Adding to JinkoSolar's (JKS +12.8%) good fortune today is the company's earlier announcement that its polycrystalline modules passed a potential induced degradation test at 85 Degrees Celsius and 85% relative humidity. The tests are a significant improvement over ones conducted several weeks ago, showing that the modules passed a PID test at 65 Degrees Celsius, and makes [[JKS] the first PV company to past tests at this high of a temperature level.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • OPTT

    Ocean Power Technologies (OPTT +6.4%) moves up after announcing its wholly owned Oregon...

    Ocean Power Technologies (OPTT +6.4%) moves up after announcing its wholly owned Oregon subsidiary, Reedsport OPT Wave Park, has received FERC approval for the full build-out of its 1.5 megawatt, grid-connected wave power station off Reedsport, Oregon. The utility has been granted a 35-year license for grid-connected, wave energy production.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • SLV

    A big rally in silver, +2.6%, catches the eye of the technicians as SLV breaks out above its...

    A big rally in silver, +2.6%, catches the eye of the technicians as SLV breaks out above its 200-day moving average. The last breakout (on the way up) was in January, and it presaged another 20% upside over the following 6 weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 13 Comments
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -32%), which filed for bankruptcy last week, projects net...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -32%), which filed for bankruptcy last week, projects net revenue of $613M on gross receipts from operations of $1.3B in the next 18 months, according to a new SEC filing. Net operating cash flow by Feb. 2014 is seen at $210M and capital spending at $224M. ATP says in the filing it doesn’t usually publish projections and they shouldn’t be relied on.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENOC

    EnerNOC (ENOC +5.1%) signs a 20 MW contract with Genesis Energy, a New Zealand national...

    EnerNOC (ENOC +5.1%) signs a 20 MW contract with Genesis Energy, a New Zealand national electricity retailer, to address transmission constraints, while at the same time, diversifying its offerings to its commercial and industrial customer base. Under the terms of the contract, the program began in July, with an opportunity to extend to 50 MW in two years' time.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • FB

    It looks as if Facebook (FB +5%) shorts (previous) are taking profits; shares have shot higher...

    It looks as if Facebook (FB +5%) shorts (previous) are taking profits; shares have shot higher in early afternoon trading. Barron's provides details about Capstone's upgrade: the firm says its data indicates total users and game players respectively rose 3.5% and 3% M/M over the past month, and that 48 tracked brands saw their Facebook "fans" increase 10% over this time (boosted by the Olympics). The gaming data could be a positive for share-losing Zynga (ZNGA +0.3%)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • LUV

    Southwest Airlines (LUV +3.5%) raises its air fares on shorter flights, prompting a flurry of...

    Southwest Airlines (LUV +3.5%) raises its air fares on shorter flights, prompting a flurry of corresponding ticket price hikes by legacy carriers such as American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK), United Continental (LCC +5.4%), and US Airways (LCC +4.9%). Last week a hike by Delta (DAL +2.9%) didn't take hold across the sector, which is nothing new with low-cost carriers such as Southwest, JetBlue (JBLU +3.4%), Spirit (SAVE +1.5%), and Allegiant (ALGT +1.6%) typically acting as the trendsetters for the group.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARIA

    ARIAD Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2%) says it's initiating its Phase 1/2 clinical trial in Japan of...

    ARIAD Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2%) says it's initiating its Phase 1/2 clinical trial in Japan of ponatinib, an investigational BCR-ABL inhibitor. The trial is being conducted in Japanese patients with chronic leukemia who have failed other treatments. ARIA expects this trial to provide the incremental clinical data needed for initial regulatory approval of the drug in Japan, which is the third largest leukemia market in the world with an annual incidence of 1,300 new patients reported in 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • SHP

    ShangPharma (SHP -2.4%) slips after missing on its Q2 results earlier today. The company also...

    ShangPharma (SHP -2.4%) slips after missing on its Q2 results earlier today. The company also reconfirms its guidance for net revenues for FY12. Net revenues are expected to be approximately $131.7 to $136.2 million, which represents growth of approximately 18% to 22% compared with FY11. William Blair cuts the shares to Market Perform on the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT +8.1%) is rallying today, possibly thanks to bullish weekend columns from SA's Ted...

    Velti (VELT +8.1%) is rallying today, possibly thanks to bullish weekend columns from SA's Ted Stamas and Bret Jensen. Stamas likes the mobile ad agency's valuation (~10x estimated 2012 EPS), and also a recent ad deal with Disney. Jensen considers Velti to be inexpensive relative to mobile ad peer Millennial Media (NYSE:MM).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • SVM

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM +4.3%) shares surge after reporting an intercept of 4.55 meters grading...

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM +4.3%) shares surge after reporting an intercept of 4.55 meters grading 2,196 grams/metric ton silver, 13.63% lead and 1.38% zinc at its LM Mine in China. SLV says the drilling program has substantially extended the downdip and striking extensions of previously defined mineralization zones within some major vein structures.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • RDA

    Chinese RF chipmaker RDA Microelectronics (RDA -4.9%) sells off after UBS downgrades to Neutral....

    Chinese RF chipmaker RDA Microelectronics (RDA -4.9%) sells off after UBS downgrades to Neutral. Until now, shares had been in a very narrow trading range since May. Though expected to grow revenue at 31% clip this year, RDA trades at roughly 5x estimated 2012 EPS (excluding cash/investments); that could be a sign the Street has accounting concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • BBY

    Richard Schulze takes a shot at Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) decision to hire turnaround specialist...

    Richard Schulze takes a shot at Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) decision to hire turnaround specialist Hubert Joly as its CEO, saying the company needs a proven leadership team with deep retail experience and knowledge of Best Buy. Though it sounds a bit like sour grapes after the company for the most part spurred its ex-founder, Schulze was correct with the part of his statement where he added value is eroding. Best Buy 6.8% lower on the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • FSLR

    A handful of solar names are posting big gains this morning: FSLR +6.4%. STP +5.6%. TSL +3.8%....

    A handful of solar names are posting big gains this morning: FSLR +6.4%. STP +5.6%. TSL +3.8%. JKS +9.1%. SOL +5.1%. The gains come even as the Chinese government, upset over the solar anti-dumping  tariffs imposed by the U.S. in May, threatens "legal measures" against American solar manufacturers over U.S. government support for various renewable energy programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • LOW

    Highlights from the Lowe's (LOW -5.4%) earnings CC: The hunt for Canadian firm Rona pushes on,...

    Highlights from the Lowe's (LOW -5.4%) earnings CC: The hunt for Canadian firm Rona pushes on, with a friendly deal preferred but a hostile takeover not ruled out. Says improvements in inventory and cost reductions after line reviews. Sees same-store sales flat for H2 with macro challenges still in place. Guidance assumes $1.5B in additional share buybacks, $18B 4-year share repurchase plan still in place. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • IAC

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -0.3%) has bought Felix, a provider of local ad services, for a reported...

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -0.3%) has bought Felix, a provider of local ad services, for a reported price of $30M. Felix, which gets paid by businesses when a "high quality" phone call is made, will be added IAC's CityGrid unit, which owns a stable of local content properties that includes Citysearch and restaurant app developer Urbanspoon. The purchase could be pressuring shares of Yelp (YELP -5.8%), which depends on local businesses for most of its ad revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • MBOT

    Shares of StemCells (STEM -10.4%) are getting whacked today, after Roth Capital cut its rating...

    Shares of StemCells (STEM -10.4%) are getting whacked today, after Roth Capital cut its rating to Neutral from Buy due to a lack of catalysts over the near-term. The firm also slashed its price target to $1.80 from $5, in what only can be considered a markedly delayed response to the company's disappointing Q2 earlier in the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • SWSH

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH -8.9%) slumps lower on word of Nasdaq non-compliance and the resignation...

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH -8.9%) slumps lower on word of Nasdaq non-compliance and the resignation of CEO Steven Berrard. Shares now trade at a 10-week low.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • SJM

    Shares of J.M. Smucker (SJM +1.6%) trade higher with Deutsche Bank raising its price target on...

    Shares of J.M. Smucker (SJM +1.6%) trade higher with Deutsche Bank raising its price target on food company to $91 from $86. The extra $5 on the PT doesn't hurt, but SA author Divideninvestr provides a little more meat on the bone for value investors with the take that the low-volatility dividend-payer provides a nice play for the long-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • JBLU

    Airline stocks take a turn higher, with gains of large carriers outpacing those seen by...

    Airline stocks take a turn higher, with gains of large carriers outpacing those seen by regionals. Consolidation, narrower debt loads, and emerging labor cost controls are the factors that could set up a sector rally if everything takes off on time, according to analysts. Advancers: JBLU +1.6%, UAL +3.5%, LUV +1.9%, DAL +2.5%, LCC +3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 3 Comments
  • TI

    Telecom Italia (TI -4.5%) slumps after being downgraded to Neutral by JPMorgan; the firm had...

    Telecom Italia (TI -4.5%) slumps after being downgraded to Neutral by JPMorgan; the firm had upgraded Telefonica in March, when shares were 29% higher. Meanwhile, fellow debt-laden peripheral eurozone incumbent telco Telefonica (TEF -0.5%) is barely moving after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from Bernstein.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • VTG

    Vantage Drilling (VTG +3.3%) says the Aquamarine Driller's customer in Malaysia has exercised...

    Vantage Drilling (VTG +3.3%) says the Aquamarine Driller's customer in Malaysia has exercised the first of its one-year options, extending the current contract to Nov. 2013. VTG expects the exercise of the option will generate ~$56M in revenue over the extension period.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • RSH

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH -4.5%) trail off after investors hit more choppy waters trying to...

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH -4.5%) trail off after investors hit more choppy waters trying to figure out the direction Best Buy 2.0 is going to take. Fair or unfair, Best Buy news can hit RSH hard with the evolving story on the future big box retailers encompassing both names.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG -14.4%) sink at the open after the firm loses its CEO. The company filed a...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG -14.4%) sink at the open after the firm loses its CEO. The company filed a 8-K with the SEC this morning in which it said that it adopted a new policy to restrict insiders from making short-term or speculative transactions on the firm' stock. The move comes after ex-CEO Robert Pederson sold off a large position from his margin account in advance of his resignation.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +7%) hires an EVP of corporate development and a director of...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +7%) hires an EVP of corporate development and a director of marketing & reimbursement, and starts expanding its commercial ops in expectation of a growth in sales of its microRNA diagnostic products. Rosetta also begins the process of adding to its oncology-focused sales team. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKNG

    More on Priceline (PCLN): JP Morgan says shares of PCLN could be under short-term pressure with...

    More on Priceline (PCLN): JP Morgan says shares of PCLN could be under short-term pressure with the disclosure that the firm may have less upside potential in Europe as its market share is adjusted upward on the fly. BofA is also a bit disturbed by the revelation, noting its adds more "uncertainty" to the mix on Europe. PCLN -1.0% premarket. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stock futures are either side of zero, with the S&P benchmark -0.1% and the...

    Market preview: Stock futures are either side of zero, with the S&P benchmark -0.1% and the Dow -0.2% but the Nasdaq +0.1%. EU shares are firmly in the red and Spanish debt yields pare sharp declines after Germany pours cold water on speculation that the ECB might do some serious bond buying. Back home, Coventry Health Care +18.5% on buyout news, while Best Buy is -5.8% after hiring a new CEO and further shenanigans over its prospective buyout.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN) warns in a 8-K filed with the SEC that it understated its share of room rights...

    Priceline (PCLN) warns in a 8-K filed with the SEC that it understated its share of room rights booked in the EU last year. Shares -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • AET

    Premarket gainers: CVH +19%. Losers: ZAGG -13%. PSTI -6%. BBY -6%. LOW -5%.

    Premarket gainers: CVH +19%.
    Losers: ZAGG -13%. PSTI -6%. BBY -6%. LOW -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) -53.2% premarket after Friday's Chapter 11 bankruptcy...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) -53.2% premarket after Friday's Chapter 11 bankruptcy announcement. ATPG says it expects its operations to continue in the ordinary course throughout the reorganization process. It's worth noting that ATP has obtained a DIP financing commitment for $617M from members of its existing senior lender group.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • PHMD

    PhotoMedex shares (NASDAQ:PHMD) jump 9.15% after the skin-health company said at the weekend...

    PhotoMedex shares (NASDAQ:PHMD) jump 9.15% after the skin-health company said at the weekend that its board has approved the repurchase of $25M worth of shares over the next 12 months. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • LOW

    Shares of Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) fall 8.4% premarket after the company's lackluster Q2 numbers and...

    Shares of Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) fall 8.4% premarket after the company's lackluster Q2 numbers and outlook for FY12 disappoints investors. One of the common themes on the Street is that management at Lowe's continues to have a hard time keeping up with counterparts at Home Depot.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM

  • Speculation that the ECB might take action to cap the spreads between peripheral and German bond...

    Speculation that the ECB might take action to cap the spreads between peripheral and German bond yields causes those of Spain to plummet. 10-year yields are -28 bps to 6.17%, while the 2-year is -39 bps to 3.38%. Italian 10-year yields are -7 bps to 5.72% and the 2-year is -9 bps to 2.96%. With German bond yields rising, the spreads are narrowing.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 AM

  • EU shares open with little clear direction, with any support coming from a weekend report that...

    EU shares open with little clear direction, with any support coming from a weekend report that the ECB could act to cap peripheral bond yields. EU Stoxx 50 flat, London flat, Paris -0.1%, Frankfurt +0.1%, Madrid +0.2%, Milan +0.2%. 10-year bond yields: Spain -12 bps to 6.32%, Italy -6 bps to 5.72%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed, with Japanese stocks again boosted by the weaker yen and Hong Kong...

    Asian shares are mixed, with Japanese stocks again boosted by the weaker yen and Hong Kong equities falling ahead of earnings results from over 300 companies this week. Japan +0.2%, Hong Kong -0.8%, China -1.2%, India closed.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 AM
